channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12480] Regions in FAILED_OPEN/FAILED_CLOSE should be processed on master failover
item.description: For zk assignment, we used to process this regions. For zk less assignment, we should do the same
item.summary: Regions in FAILED_OPEN/FAILED_CLOSE should be processed on master failover

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch for master
It would be good if you can take a look Jimmy Xiang
Are you sure this is an issue for 2.0.0? I remember I tried to file a similar jira before and didn't becase it is not an issue after I looked into it (for master branch, not other branches).

Before regions get into such states, we have tried many times already. If the region server dies, SSH will retry in case things are changed. If the region server stays up, there may be no need to retry at all. If admin fixes the problem causing failed open/close, they can re-assign the region from shell. What do you think?

BTW, no need to change serverManager.isServerOnline(regionState.getServerName()) I think, it should do exactly what you want.

Thanks for the quick review Jimmy on a Friday evening!

If admin fixes the problem causing failed open/close, they can re-assign the region from shell

In our case, we see regions going in failed open due to mainly two reasons
1) sometimes we have datanodes behaving badly causing regionservers to be unable to open regions and lot of regions end up in FAILED_OPEN
2) Sometimes master cannot find a region plan after many attempts and makes the region failed open (This is more common for us due to custom group stuff as sometimes all region servers in the group are dead)
The admin could reassign from shell but the our admin likes restarting master as a first try when it comes to any assignment issues. I think it would be good to maintain that 0.94 behaviour.

no need to change serverManager.isServerOnline(regionState.getServerName()) I think

isServerOnline(ServerName) will return false when serverName is null (It will be null in case 2 above). This will cause (!serverManager.isServerOnline(regionState.getServerName()) to be true causing the method to return and will not proceed to the switch case.

Are you sure this is an issue for 2.0.0?

No. But the test fails without the patch and passes with it. But the test could be wrong. Can you do a check? Thanks!

I see. 

 +                && serverName != null && onlineServers.contains(serverName)) {

No need this change. If serverName is null, onlineServers should not contain it.

isServerOnline(ServerName) will return false when serverName is null (It will be null in case 2 above)

In master branch, the server should be never null if it is in these states.

+      case FAILED_CLOSE:

+      case FAILED_OPEN:

+        unassign(regionInfo, regionState.getServerName(), null);

...

Should use invokeUnAssign.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12681691/HBASE-12480.patch
against trunk revision .

This message is automatically generated.

If serverName is null, onlineServers should not contain it.

Problem is onlineServers cannot do that contain check. Passing null to ConcurrentMap.keySet().contains() will throw NPE

In master branch, the server should be never null if it is in these states.

TestAssignmentManagerOnCluster.testFailedOpen() asserts for null server in failed open state. Could we have a possible case on real cluster where we try to assign a region not in region states and end up in similar situation?

Should use invokeUnAssign.

Hmm, will make the change. My initial thinking was that we need to make blocking calls but that doesn't seem to matter.

Passing null to ConcurrentMap.keySet().contains() will throw NPE

Right. OK.

Hmm, will make the change. My initial thinking was that we need to make blocking calls but that doesn't seem to matter.

May not use invokeUnAssign directly. It's better to do it asynchronously.
Cancelling stale patch

Jimmy, can you give feedback on one more question (pasted again below) I had before. I will create a revised patch after that.

TestAssignmentManagerOnCluster.testFailedOpen() asserts for null server in failed open state. Could we have a possible case on real cluster where we try to assign a region not in region states and end up in similar situation?
You meant testOpenFailed? Yes, it may be null. I see. It's better to handle it. Thanks.
Moving out of 0.98.9
We will have a RC for 0.98.10 probably Jan 12. Any chance of an update on this before then?
Yes, I will put a patch by today

Got delayed on here.
Patch attached after addressing the comment of calling assign() asynchronously.
Patch for 0.98 and branch-1 also attached.
